greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n with k parts p at position p (fixed points), n>=0, 0<=k<=A003056(n).
reference: M. Archibald, A. Blecher and A. Knopfmacher, Fixed points in compositions and words, accepted by the Journal of Integer Sequences.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..500, flattened
M. Archibald, A. Blecher, and A. Knopfmacher, Fixed Points in Compositions and Words, J. Int. Seq., Vol. 23 (2020), Article 20.11.1.
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, expand(
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, Expand[Sum[b[n-j, i+1]*If[i == j, x, 1], {j, 1, n}]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 1]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Same as A238349 without the trailing zeros.
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 25 2014
